chapter.title: Validation
chapter.para: Let us look at how to use MiPlatform to process validation on user input information when developing view.

section.title: Using UI Component
section.para: Basic validation can be processed by using the properties of UI component when developing view with MiPlatform PID. Refer to the MiPlatform PID Help manual for more information.

section.title: Size Validation
section.para: Selects the size of input information.

row.entry: Char: Length limit is based on characters. One unit per character. Byte: Length limit is based on bytes. Asian characters and some symbols are calculated as two units per character.
Char: Length limit is based on characters. One unit per character. Byte: Length limit is based on bytes. Asian characters and some symbols are calculated as two units per character.

section.title: Type Validation
section.para: Selects type and format of input information.

listitem.para: Selects input mode type of relevant cell
upper: Inputs only upper case letters
lower: Inputs only lower case letters
mask: Inputs only values that fit the mask defined in mask property

section.title: MaskEdit
section.para: Develops input form of zip code, resident registration number, etc. using MaskEdit component.

section.title: Using Script
section.para: This sample provides script function that enables the user to process input information validation on view all at once.

section.title: Check Validity
section.para: gfnValidate() processes the validation of all components that are under components defined as input parameters. Checking is based on the check list inputted into UserData of each UI component. Grid uses the check list inputted into the MapValue property of each column from Grid's BindDataset, rather than UserData properties.

row.entry: Base component for executing validation (e.g., Form, Div).

section.title: Check List for Validation
section.para: Each item of the check list for validation processing is separated with comma (,). Among title, titleObj, and titleId to be used when showing error message, one should be stated at the front.

section.title: General Components
section.para: For general UI components other that Grid, a check list which consists of the following items should be defined in UserData properties.

row.entry: Item name used when error message is shown

For required items, error message is shown when value does not exist.

entry.para: Error message is shown when the the item value is shorter than the minimum length. The base unit is not byte, so define as length of input characters.
MaxLength property value definition can be done instead of maximum length check. If MaxLength is set, input cannot exceed the set length.

section.title: Grid Component
section.para: Other than general UI components, to process validation of Grid component input information, check list should be stated in MapValue properties of each column in BindDataset.

section.title: Notice

listitem.para: Set the UseClientLayout property to true. UseClientLayout is included in BindDataset of Grid subject to validation.
Never use clear() for BindDataset of Grid subject to validation. When necessary, use clearData().

entry.para: Check the minimum length of column. The base unit is not byte so define as length of input characters.
Set limit property value which is Body Cell Property of Grid, instead of checking maximum length. If limit value is set, input cannot exceed limit.
